issue_comments.body:
Sounds good, but complicated. 

I received an email from formspree lately. That was probably from your testing of the contact form for Internet. So this part should work. 

As for the ZeroNet part: Your ideas look good, but a bit complicated. It would be cool if something like this worked in the end. But for the moment, it is ok to have a static page listing the options to get in touch.

pull_request_comments.body:
I can't see neither your code nor the demo site at the moment. I'll probably have to wait for both of us to be online at the same time. Or probably it will also work, if you load it on a proxy, that then keeps it in cache for a few hours.

As to the theme: I prefer to not have the theme in the repo. I wanted to add theme downloading to the publish_zeronet.sh script. But just didn't have the time yet. 
Did you have to change anything in the theme files?

Once I can load your code, I will disect it. Or even better, if you could edit the pull request to not contain the theme files. That would help keeping the repo small.
